Summary: Carmine Giammarino from Prebon introduces himself and expresses interest in resuming gas daily trades, focusing on the West Coast markets. He requests to speak with Mike Grigsby regarding potential markets of interest, having been informed that Mike is key for such collaborations. Mike responds, offering Randy Gay and Frank Ermis for contact and stating he handles CA online market making.

Subject:
Price Reservations 19 May 2001 Real-Time Market and 20 May 2001
 Day-Ahead Market
Summary: The New York Independent System Operator (NYISO) is reserving specific hours in the Real-Time Market on May 19, 2001, and certain hours in the Day-Ahead Market on May 20, 2001, to verify prices. The reserved hours affect multiple regions including PJM, Ontario Hub (OH), Quebec Hub (HQ), and New England (NE). The email provides a link to the official posting on their website for further details.

Subject: Re: Strictly confidential
Summary: Michelle Cash informs David Oxley that Mike McCall is not under a current employment agreement, referencing a draft agreement sent on December 2, 1999, with no further updates. She lacks information on McCall's salary, options, or other employment terms. Oxley inquires about McCall's current terms and potential advice if McCall were to be let go.

Subject: Travel
Summary: The sender is planning to travel to Sao Paulo next Tuesday, arriving Monday night and leaving Wednesday morning. The purpose of the trip is to meet with Andrea Bertone to review physical and financial trading information in Brazil and to set up meetings with the commercial group for discussing alternative deal structures on certain transactions. The sender requests confirmation of availability for these meetings and mentions coordinating with Andrea to schedule these additional meetings.

Subject: Re: New Power Invoice
Summary: Mary Ellenberger is addressing a power invoice issue. She plans to forward the request to Darla Saruicer, who is the customer representative for The New Power. This suggests a financial matter related to billing or accounts.

Subject: Confidence
Summary: Georgia Matula, an employee from EES Data Management, expresses her unwavering confidence in Enron and its ethical standards. She shares her pride in returning to the company after a 5-year absence, emphasizing her continued loyalty despite being laid off. Matula also conveys her support through prayers and encouragement during challenging times.

Whittney Skinner, a prospective summer intern, informs that she needs to return to Norman by July 20 due to her sorority president obligations at OU. She is available from May 14 to July 20 and inquires if this schedule would work for the 12-week summer analyst program. She requests a prompt response to understand if her availability aligns with the program requirements.

Subject: Link to Game Lines
Summary: The email from enronsportsbook@yahoo.com provides a link to game lines on the USA Today sports section, specifically for Sheridan's Odds. It includes step-by-step navigation instructions for finding the college games listed at the bottom. The email concludes with an advertisement for Yahoo! Messenger's international calling service.

Subject: Give The Gift Of Global Intelligence.  Get The Agenda.
Summary: The email is an external communication from the Financial Times, The Americas, promoting a holiday gift subscription offer for the Financial Times newspaper. The offer includes a free 2002 Financial Times Desk Diary and must be given by December 21, 2001, to start in early January. The promotional period ends on January 31, 2002.

Subject: Re: 2000 Plan Allocations and January Allocations
Summary: Daren Farmer reports on the allocation of the 1/00 plan for RC 1497, detailing 15% of time dedicated to Gas Network Services, 84% to Gas Network Trading, and 1% to Gas Network Development. The time spent on Project Sally involved estimating employee requirements for Trading Support functions and reviewing the deal memorandum.

Subject: LV Cogen QF agreement.
Summary: This email discusses a power sale agreement between LV Cogen, a 50 MW PURPA Qualifying Facility, and Nevada Power Company. LV Cogen sells 45 MW to NPC during specific months, with EPMI marketing the excess output. EPMI purchases transmission from NPC and sells power at the Px or ISO at Mead, sometimes needing additional wheels from Mead to Palo Verde due to congestion. The peak hour production is 50 MW, with a total daily output of 1200 Mw.

Subject: Enron Messenging Board
Summary: Laura Harder inquires about the usage and feedback on the Enron messaging board system among colleagues. Ina Rangel forwards the request, asking specific individuals to gather traders' opinions for a decision on whether to make the system permanent.

Subject: Natural Gas Futures Continue Higher on Short-Covering
Summary: This email discusses natural gas futures and prices, providing detailed regional and future contract information. It also includes updates on energy-related news, such as Enron's trading operations being acquired by UBS Warburg and the impact of Enron's bankruptcy on other energy traders like Mirant, Duke, and the Intercontinental Exchange. The email also mentions the wind energy industry's record-breaking year in 2001 and the expiration of the federal wind production tax credit. Additionally, it contains advertisements for various energy-related services and seminars.

Subject: Mike Bryant-out of office
Summary:
Mike Bryant is scheduled to be out of the office for an appointment on January 18, 2001, from 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM Central Standard Time. The Outlook Migration Team is designated as the chairperson for this entry.

Category: Internal Company & HR
Summary: This email announces Mike Bryant's unavailability during a specific time slot for an appointment, managed by the Outlook Migration Team.

Subject: Re: Equistar Buybacks
Summary: Robert Lloyd clarifies that there is only one valid buyback ticket (246408) for meter #1373, which supports Equistar allocation/billing automation initiated in April 2000. He explains that the earlier ticket (156342) was used to set up buybacks across multiple meters and that Equistar's transition to ENA Matrix required establishing a new buyback ticket. Lloyd confirms that ENA activity remains separate, with HPL handling the swing, and expresses appreciation for the collaboration opportunity.

Subject: Upcoming Energy Conference - Kaminski Requirements
Summary: Shirley Crenshaw is requested to provide Mr. Kaminski's presentation materials for an upcoming energy conference in Miami, including a PR photo, handouts, and his flight itinerary. The conference coordinator, Dawn Scovill, needs these details to finalize room setups and conference books. The email emphasizes the urgency for prompt attention.

Subject: Deal # 508797
Summary: Melissa Murphy from Enron has confirmed the execution of a termination letter for deal #508797.01. She inquires if the team intends to proceed with the termination, as Holli Krebs is already informed about the impending action.

Subject: EB2132 - Jill (Team Leadership Mtg.)
Summary: This email is a calendar entry for a team leadership meeting on January 26, 2001, from 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM Central Standard Time. The meeting is chaired by Stacey W. White and is likely an internal discussion or strategy session involving team leaders.

Subject: Latin American Energy Crisis Conference Call
Summary: Hank Emery, from henry.emery@ubspainewebber.com, is sharing an announcement for a conference call organized by UBS Warburg Analysts. The call, scheduled for tomorrow at 10:00 am CST, focuses on the Latin American Energy Crisis and its implications for major foreign players including ENE, AES, DUKE, Endesa, EdP, Iberdrola, and Tracetebel. He advises against transmitting account orders or instructions via email due to PaineWebber's policies on email communication security and confidentiality.

Subject: Alaska cruise/gift for Mom's retirement
Summary: Debbie is seeking input on a proposed Alaska cruise vacation for her parents' retirement gift, with options from Royal Caribbean's "Vision of the Seas" for either June or July departures. The cruise costs range from $1300 to $1699 per person for an inside or ocean-view room, with an additional $900 for a 3-day land package visiting Denali and McKinley. Debbie has made a courtesy reservation for the July cruise with an ocean-view room and plans to consult her travel agent for further advice before finalizing the decision.

Subject: 2000 Peaker Turbine Nominal Output
Summary: Richard Broussard from Enron provides nominal outputs for 2000 peaker turbines at ISO under specified conditions. The data is detailed for Wheatland and Lincoln Center units, listing turbine types, power (kW), and heat rate (Btu/kWh LHV). Gleason's nominal values are missing, and corrected numbers will be used until further information is available.

Subject: Re: LIH
Summary: Sheryl Gussett from Bracewell & Patterson, L.L.P. mentions an embarrassing situation where a client found out about year-end deal details before she could inform them. She then inquires about attending Ted's dinner party on Saturday, to which Elizabeth Sager from Enron confirms attendance around 5:30 PM and mentions wildfires affecting both locations.
Matthew Lenhart inquires about plans for the weekend, suggesting golf as an activity. The email is informal and does not pertain to business, HR, finance, legal matters, or external communications.

Delainey and Shankman are discussing the organization and next steps for the "east desk," likely a business or operational unit within Enron. Delainey seeks consensus on how the east desk should function, and Shankman inquires about the best approach for presenting this to all relevant desks, suggesting either a single comprehensive meeting or a staggered rollout with his managing the additional desk presentations.

Subject: CSC MRS Presentation
Summary: The email contains a presentation from the previous day's MRS meeting, focusing on calculated TTC limits between zones for the on-peak summer base case. The sender, Kenneth Donohoo, is a Manager of System Planning at ERCOT, indicating a work-related context. The email concludes with a friendly note wishing the recipient a great weekend.

Subject: ENA/Devon
Summary: Shonnie Daniel from Enron has sent a draft of a Gathering Agreement between ENA and Lost Creek for review. The agreement pertains to the Devon Beaver Creek transaction. Comments and feedback are requested.

Subject: FW: PG&E
Summary: The email thread discusses a proposal to offer El Paso capacity to PG&E during their bankruptcy settlement negotiations as a means to potentially reduce Enron's claim against PG&E. Barry Tycholiz mentions that PG&E is hesitant about using the El Paso pipe due to flow risk concerns but suggests it could be an economically beneficial, albeit low-value, position for Enron. Leslie Lawner initiates the idea, and it is proposed that Lisa Mellencamp and Michael Tribolet, who are handling the bankruptcy case, should be contacted for further logistical discussions.

Subject: Name Overlay 0426
Summary: Cheryl Johnson from Enron informs about a name overlay in GCP, where Vopak USA Inc. replaces Van Waters & Rogers Inc. (CP ID 9784). Shortname changes are scheduled for this morning, and records will be inactivated late afternoon on Tuesday, 05/01/01.

Subject: HPL Meter
Summary: Judy Townsend from Enron received a detailed report from lamoss@duke-energy.com regarding the HPL Meter. The report outlines extensive work required before custody transfer measurement can be performed, including valve overhauls, meter tube inspections and honing, transmitter replacements, and RTU board furnishing. The estimated time for re-working the station controls, valves, meter runs, and EGM is 1.5 months.

Subject: Retail Deal with Food Industry Alliance Closed
Summary: An aggregation deal with the New York Food Industry Alliance (FIA) has been successfully closed, expected to generate a margin of at least $1.3 million. The deal was initiated by Howard Fromer in the fall and finalized with assistance from EES and the FIA President, despite several member concerns. Fromer's proximity in the FIA's Albany office was a persuasive factor in securing the deal over a competitor's offer.

Subject: Markup of Power Sale Agreement
Summary: John Llodra has forwarded a marked-up Draft Power Sale Agreement with New Hampshire Electric Coop to Elizabeth Sager and Paul Racicot. He has added critical language in Article 14.2 to ensure Installed Capability is credited by ISO-NE even during Seabrook outages, maintaining liability for providing ICAP. Comments are needed by noon Eastern Time on March 13th, with a request for discussion via phone at 978-449-9936.

Subject: Industry Standard's Net Returns speakers
Summary: Mike McConnell is inquiring about Enron's potential participation in speaking at the Industry Standard's Net Returns conference in Aspen. The conference is scheduled for September 7, with a keynote slot available. Stephen Horn is suggested to RSVP for the speaking engagement, with McMahon's availability to be considered for another Enron representative. The list of confirmed speakers includes high-profile executives from various companies.

Subject: RE: Bankers Trust/Deutsche Bank
Summary: Tana Jones from Enron is updating a group on the status of negotiations with Deutsche Bank regarding Bankers Trust trades. Deutsche Bank is uncertain about handling online trades and prefers a full novation after resolving documentation issues. Jones advises to hold off on any actions related to Bankers Trust financial trades and master agreements until further updates.

The email from john.lavorato@enron.com appears to pertain to business operations, specifically requesting the leasing of space for EOTT, likely involving logistical or facility management aspects. No subject is provided, but the body content suggests an action item related to real estate or equipment.

Subject: ILA: Initiating Coverage of a Pure-Play Energy Merchant
Summary: This email from Raymond C. Niles of Salomon Smith Barney initiates coverage of Aquila, Inc. with a Buy rating and a 12-month price target of $44. Aquila is described as a pure-play Energy Merchant with strong trading and risk management skills in growing energy commodity markets. The projection is for a 20-25% growth rate for ILA, currently trading at a discount with a 0.7x PEG ratio compared to peers' average of 1.0x.

Subject: Work Request for Ongoing Power Banding
Summary: Steve Walker from CSC is forwarding a work request for ongoing power banding pricing to Enron colleagues. The document, Power Banding - Ongoing.doc, is attached for submission to Jackie. Steve also mentions the need to discuss a Historical Work Request with Chris Stokely on Monday.

Subject: Start Date: 12/22/01; HourAhead hour: 14;
Summary: This email pertains to the scheduling and operations of the HourAhead service, indicating a start date of December 22, 2001, at 14:00. It mentions no ancillary schedules were awarded and no variances were detected, suggesting a routine operational update. The log messages reference a parsing file for ISO final schedules, further emphasizing operational details.

Subject: Re: APS/Pinnacle West
Summary: Stephanie Piwetz informs Kate Symes about a discrepancy in naming conventions for trades between APS and Pinnacle West. All trades should be under Pinnacle West, except those confirmed by Bloomberg, which should retain APS. Kate confirms changes to trade records and seeks clarification on handling old counterparty names post-Bloomberg recognition switch.

Subject: FW: Fw: Job Interview Skills
Summary: Donna Mullen forwards an amusing anecdote about a job interview, shared among colleagues, emphasizing the importance of tactful observation during interviews. The story involves a hiring manager without ears and candidates who respond honestly but impolitely, leading to their dismissal, until a young, witty candidate humorously points out the manager's contact lenses.

Subject: Re: [smu-betas] Dent's wrath
Summary: The email is a Halloween greeting from Samuraimai, a member of the 'smu-betas' group, expressing displeasure over UT's national championship win. It humorously mentions demolishing a tower in Austin and targeting it for a "raghead's" flyby. The sender also invites fellow group members to a potential future BETA reunion, noting the success of a previous Homecoming 2000 gathering.

Subject: Weekend Outage Report for 10-19-01 through 10-21-01
Summary: This email details scheduled system outages for various Enron facilities and applications from October 19 to October 21, 2001. The outages include power repairs in Enron Center South, server migrations, network routing changes, and hardware upgrades for systems like SAP and EnLighten. Specific times and affected environments are listed for each outage, along with contact information for assistance.

Subject: Document Retention
Summary: This email, from Enron's legal department, outlines the Company's obligation to retain documents related to ongoing or threatened investigations and lawsuits, as per a Bankruptcy Court's February 15, 2002 Order. It provides a detailed list of topics to be retained, including special purpose entities, LJM entities, accounting records, structured finance documents, communications with analysts, investors, and rating agencies, and documents related to various projects, acquisitions, and regulatory bodies. The list is extensive and non-inclusive, urging recipients to review subpoenas and document requests for precise topics. Contact details for the Company's Litigation Manager are provided for any queries.

Subject: RE:
Summary: Mike Marcoux, a Mechanical Design Engineer at Boston Engineering, is looking for a new roommate starting July as his current roommate is moving out. He describes his current apartment in West Newton, its features, and the monthly rent of $1450. He asks colleagues and others on the email list if they or anyone they know might be interested in the room, emphasizing that potential roommates should not be "a complete psychopath."

Subject: Site Visits - Peakers
Summary: Southern Energy, Inc. is requesting specific dates for site visits at Lincoln Energy on Oct. 16th and Wheatland on Oct. 17th. They plan to send a team of about 10 members and will provide a list of names, titles, and affiliations once confirmed. Contact information for inquiries is provided.

Subject: Re: WestLB
Summary: Kay Mann is requesting a list of all equipment purchased through WestLB for refinancing purposes. Cheryl Costa informs Kay that the Mitsubishi equipment was bought via WestLB and she is also handling a steam turbine and four HRSGs purchase through a WestLB structure for the Las Vegas Cogen Project. Kay asks for any additional information on other WestLB-related equipment or change orders from the team.

Subject: Peaker projects
Summary: Jinsung Myung is requesting immediate access to LiveLink for Ben. To facilitate this, Jinsung instructs Ben to provide Carolyn with his NT Log-on ID, email address, and extension (37330). Ben also needs to complete a security request for LiveLink access. Carolyn is informed that the access is urgently needed, preferably by the end of the day.

Subject: Our meeting
Summary: David Dupre, an applicant, expresses interest in joining a group at Enron, highlighting his skills in Excel, Access, Bloomberg, and quantitative analysis, particularly in meteorology. He emphasizes his ability to uncover crucial market-affecting information and his commitment to contributing significantly to the group. Dupre also mentions leveraging his existing Enron and CIBC World Markets experience in financial modeling and derivatives.

Subject: Stella Chan /Project Summer transfers
Summary: The email discusses the transfer of Stella Chan, a Director-level expat from the SK Enron JV in Korea, to the Corporate Public Affairs group. The transfer is being considered despite a movement moratorium on "EI" companies, as Chan's contract ends in March 2001 and she has found a replacement, Waymon Votaw, from the Southern Cone group. The sender seeks approval to proceed with the transfer and the next steps for both Chan and Votaw.

Subject: Wheeling Pitt consignment
Summary: Kay Mann from Enron is informing about a potential credit issue with the Wheeling Pitt consignment. She requests patience for further updates. The client, however, is reportedly satisfied with the service provided.

The email discusses a recent meeting hosted by Jeff, with the sender's company (PG&E) still deliberating on their stance regarding a gas accord. The sender advises Jeff to persist in pursuing business opportunities within the company, despite previous lack of response, suggesting a need to overcome internal skepticism towards certain entities like Enron. The sender encourages Jeff to escalate efforts to higher management levels.

Subject: Energy Company Values Sink In Response to Changing Times
Summary: Constellation Energy's stock plummeted 11% following announcements of lowered earnings projections, shelved company split plans, and termination of a partnership with Goldman Sachs. The company cited falling energy prices, changing California power crisis dynamics, and weak economic conditions as reasons for the strategic shift. Constellation will pay Goldman Sachs $355 million to end their agreement, incurring a $200-million special expense in the fourth quarter. Meanwhile, Allegheny Energy also postponed its IPO for its unregulated power generation subsidiary due to unfavorable market conditions. Both companies' stock values have significantly dropped, reflecting industry-wide trends of lower power prices and diminished investor confidence.

Subject: Enron Noncompetition Agreement; Important Notice
Summary: This email from andrew.wu@enron.com contains a Memorandum from Jim Derrick to Enron attorneys regarding a recently executed Noncompetition Agreement. The agreement involves Enron Corp., Enron Energy Services, LLC, and their controlled affiliates. The email emphasizes the confidential nature of the agreement and instructs recipients to treat it with strict confidence, circulating the Memorandum to relevant business unit attorneys and distributing attachments to the Enron Corporate Development Group and the Enron Executive Committee.

Chris Dorland is requesting a brief meeting with the recipient, Jon, during the afternoon. The email does not provide details about the meeting's purpose, indicating it might be a personal or HR-related matter.

Category: Internal Company & HR
Summary: This email is from Chris Dorland to Jon, seeking a short meeting time without specifying the topic, suggesting it's likely an internal company or HR-related discussion.

Subject: Re: Gatherco
Summary: Chris Germany confirms that Gloria is handling the task related to Gatherco, while Victor is unavailable for the rest of the week.

Subject: Manager promotion
Summary: Richard McKeel's career progression at ECT is outlined, detailing his role in the Data Administration group from 1996, his contributions to Project Sirius and database designs for various systems, and his subsequent promotion to Systems Integration Analyst in Global Data Management in 1998, where he managed change processes and new software development for interfacing Global applications with strategic systems like Sitara, Unify, EnPower, Solarc, SAP, and EnronOnline. This email appears to be an internal memo or update regarding his qualifications for a potential promotion.

Subject: Re: M&M Wedding!
Summary: Ben Rogers is informing the recipient about the attendance of former roommates at an upcoming wedding, mentioning apartments Q42 and Q44, and expressing anticipation for the ensuing festivities.

Subject: RE: yo
Summary:
Matt Smith updates on personal plans, mentioning a possible trip to South Padre Island and a visit from his brother in Florida. He also shares that his skiing trip might be postponed until March. The email exchange started with Matt inquiring about the status of Pirnie/AFI contract negotiations.

Category: Personal & Informal
Summary: Steve Harriman responds to Matt Smith's inquiry about contract negotiations, stating that Raul and John Batten are meeting with the new administration to discuss their services, implying no immediate update on the contract. Harriman also asks Matt if he went skiing.

Subject:
Steve Kean's speech on California, Madrid 12/6; EURELECTRIC mission
 to the USA: Report
Summary: Peter Styles from Enron is sharing a draft report from EURELECTRIC's study visit to California, emphasizing key issues like decoupling of wholesale and retail markets, guaranteed benefits to smaller consumers, and insufficient demand-side and generation investment signals. He requests input from Alfredo, Teun, Paul, and another Paul for market-specific lessons by week's end. The email also contains a forwarded report from Sandra James titled "EURELECTRIC mission to the USA: Report."

It includes links to customize or turn off these reports and advertisements for related products and services.

Subject:
September 20, 2000 Finance/Origination M&A Legal Group Staff
 Meeting
Summary: This email announces a staff meeting for the Finance/Origination M&A Legal Group scheduled for September 20, 2000, at 10:00 a.m. in EB32C2. It provides teleconference details for those unable to attend in person, with a call-in number, access code, and host code. The email is sent by Julia Murray and Sheila Tweed from Enron North America Corp.

Subject: Upcoming Lunch
Summary: Carol is inviting Tanya to a lunch meeting on Friday with Sara to educate legal assistants on ISDA and CSA Schedules and confirmations. Carol is considering inviting newer credit people, specifically Nidia Mendoza and Cathy Tudon, for this session. Carol is seeking Tanya's input on the attendees.

Subject: Re: Merry Xmas and a Happy New Year!
Summary: This email is a seasonal greeting from Les Clewlow to Vince Kaminski and others at Enron, wishing them a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year. Vince responds with the same wishes. The content is informal and not related to business operations, financial matters, or external communications.

Subject: New Position (Sam Smith)
Summary: Mike Roberts is proposing the creation of a new position, Staff Specialist, within the research group for Sam Smith. The role involves technical duties such as quality control of weather forecasting procedures, preparing the research Intelligence newsletter, assembling the Morning Report, and overseeing hurricane season surveillance and satellite systems. The position is to be effective retroactively from January 1st of the current year.

Subject: syncretic: M-W's Word of the Day
Summary: This email is a daily Word of the Day newsletter from Merriam-Webster, featuring the word "syncretic" with its definition, example sentence, etymology, and instructions for subscribing or unsubscribing to the service. It also informs readers that the Word of the Day will not be sent on December 24, 25, and 26.

Subject: Par Forward EOL product
Summary: This email pertains to reviewing and potentially amending the General Terms and Conditions (GTCs) for Enron's Canadian FX product, specifically to align with ISDA language. Sara Shackleton requests a call to discuss confirmation forms, and Carlos suggests amending product descriptions. The email's focus is on legal and financial terms related to a product offering.

Subject: VP
Summary: Mike Grigsby inquires about eligibility for the VP investment program to secure access for this year's bonus. He suggests taking action to secure this if not already granted. The email is informal, using a closing signature "Grigsby" instead of a formal sign-off.

Subject: Guaranty Letter
Summary: Freddy Sanches, Vice President of Economics and Finance at STEAG Power LLC, has sent a guaranty agreement for review to Greg Brazaitis at Enron. The document, titled "HPL GUARANTY.doc," contains revisions that Sanches requests Brazaitis to review and provide feedback on. The email also includes contact details for Sanches.

Subject: Employee Referral Program
Summary: Enron is continuing its Employee Referral Program, offering a $5000 reward for successful hires. The program will run until further notice, with details and submission procedures available on the HR website. Referrals must follow the outlined policy and be submitted before the candidate's interview to be eligible for the bonus.

Subject: Re: apb check out
Summary: The email discusses an APB (Accounting Policy Board) check-out period, which has been adjusted to March 28 to March 31, as noted by Mark. Kate Symes is informed of this change and confirms it looks good. The email pertains to internal operational scheduling within Enron.

Subject: PowerMarketers.com Daily Power Report for 8 March 2001
Summary: This email contains a daily power report from PowerMarketers.com, featuring breaking energy news and information. It includes links to various stories on topics such as power plant constructions, earnings estimates, and energy conferences. The report also promotes upcoming events like the PMA's spring Power Markets 2001 Conference and the Certified Power Marketer examination. Additionally, it highlights a new guide on e-business in the energy industry and provides information on becoming a certified power marketer.

Subject: RE: Form
Summary: Becky Spencer is inquiring about a Credit Review Sheet form that Brent Hendry mentioned she should have provided. Sara Shackleton responds that Becky should contact Tom Moran, Veronica Gonzales, or Bjorn Hagelmann for the form. Becky had previously asked Sara for the form, leading to her current confusion about its distribution.

Subject: Start Date: 4/11/01; HourAhead hour: 8;  <CODESITE>
Summary: This email pertains to the scheduling and operations of the HourAhead service, indicating a start date of April 11, 2001, at hour 8. It mentions no ancillary schedules were awarded and no variances were detected, along with parsing a specific file for ISO final schedules.

Subject: It's almost time
Summary: This email appears to be an internal memo from Enron's announcements address, instructing employees to check their "pulse" on Monday. The phrase "check your pulse" could be a metaphor for an employee survey, health check, or a performance review. It does not pertain to business operations, finances, external communications, or personal matters.

Subject: houston visit
Summary: JMF comments on the recipient's timing for visiting Houston, recounts a recent trip to Portland for personal reasons, mentions cheap flight costs and good weather, and expresses interest in the recipient's work in Houston.

Subject: California Power Markets
Summary: Steven Kean from Enron is forwarded an analysis on the California Power Crisis by Suzanne Nimocks from McKinsey. The analysis is attached as a PowerPoint file (10209 zxd414.ppt). The email advises Kean to review the analysis, with an invitation to ask questions if needed.

Subject: NIPSCO Choice
Summary: Doug Kinney from Columbia Energy Group is requesting a price quote for transporting estimated monthly flowing volume requirements for the NIPSCO Choice program, including peak-day requirements. The necessary details are provided in the attached Excel file (NIPSCO Choice Est Vol Reqs.xls), specifically in columns L, M, and N. Kinney invites any questions via phone call.

Subject: RE: ERCOT Counterparties
Summary: This email chain discusses the list of top trading counterparties in ERCOT, with Mike Curry requesting confirmation that Tom Martin received the list. Jeff King originally provided the list, which includes companies like Calpine, Dynegy, Mirant, Aquila, and others, to ensure all necessary master agreements are in place for Enron's power and gas operations in Texas.

Subject: EES Files
Summary: Kit Blair has prepared EES and PGES files up to March and is ready to send them to the appropriate person at EES. Kit is awaiting instructions on who to forward these files to.

Subject: RE: Hello!
Summary: Kevin Jurica, a colleague, invites Gerald Nemec to jam musically together, mentioning they both play instruments - Kevin plays drums and Gerald is learning guitar. They discuss meeting at Keneally's on Thursday, with Gerald mentioning possible work commitments that might keep him late. The email exchange also includes personal updates about Kevin's move to Houston and their shared experience at Kenneally's.

Subject: Dell Computer - Saved Quote Information
Summary: This email from Dell's pagemaster informs the recipient, Mark E Taylor, about a saved E-Quote for computer equipment. The E-Quote, number E000520807, named "upgraded," includes details like the items (2x memory 60GB hard drive), was saved on December 14, 2000, and expires on January 13, 2001. Instructions are provided to retrieve the E-Quote via the Dell Online Store.

Subject: ETS and  Corporate Change Control
Summary: The Telephony team will perform maintenance on the telephone switch in 3AC starting January 28 at 6:00 PM. The maintenance is expected to last approximately one hour, causing brief outages for specific blocks of phone numbers. The affected number ranges include several groups, with details provided in the email. This change will impact ETS users, and support contact information for the ETS Solution Center is given for assistance.

Subject: MG plc's Integration with Enron NetWorks L.P.
Summary: This email chain discusses the integration of MG plc into Enron NetWorks L.P. The sender, Stephen H Douglas, has provided a PowerPoint presentation outlining the necessary steps for this integration. The presentation includes visual cues (dotted lines in red and solid red lines) to illustrate the changes at each stage of the reorganization process.

katherine.kelly@enron.com, edward.terry@enron.com, randall.gay@enron.com, 
	george.smith@enron.com, daren.farmer@enron.com, pat.clynes@enron.com
Subject: Re: Request for Application Report List
Summary: Robert Superty is requesting a list of required reports from CES systems by January 14, 2000, to be consolidated from a logistics perspective. Bryce Baxter forwarded an initial request from Richard Burchfield, including an attached spreadsheet for reporting needs. The deadline for responses is Friday, January 14, and users needing access to this data must also provide their logon IDs by the same date.

Subject: RE: Draft of Organizational Announcement
Summary: The email discusses the formation of a new corporate equity investment unit, Enron Principal Investments, combining existing investment units of ENA, EBS, and Enron Investment Partners. The unit will also include the Enron Wholesale Restructuring Group, led by Kevin Garland as Managing Director. The reporting structure is under debate, with suggestions to have it report to Greg Whalley, an Enron Policy Committee member, or to establish a new investment committee consisting of Whalley, Rice, and Delainey, with Garland reporting to this group.

Subject: Start Date: 10/15/01; HourAhead hour: 15;  <CODESITE>
Summary: This email pertains to the scheduling and data retrieval process for HourAhead, starting from 10/15/01. It indicates no ancillary schedules were awarded and no variances were detected. An error message is present regarding the retrieval of HourAhead price data, but the process continues despite this issue.
The email from john.arnold@enron.com is a personal, informal message implying a social debt, likely not related to work or business matters.

Subject: presentation next week to Southern Gas Association
Summary: Stephen Burns from Enron has been invited to speak at the Southern Gas Association conference on Friday. He will present during a "Pipeline Right-of-Way Round Table" session, focusing on the impact of fiber optic federal lands Right-of-Way (ROW) issues on pipelines. The invitation comes from someone who heard him speak on a related topic last December.

Subject: NAES meeting in Barton Creek in Austin
Summary: Steven Kean is organizing a Regulatory Update meeting at Barton Creek in Austin for approximately 100 people from Amanda's team. The meeting will cover gas and electricity regulatory positions, initiatives, and events relevant from a retail perspective. Laura Houston (x3366) is the contact, and presenters should inform Sheila Hatten of their presentation method (overheads or slides).

Subject: (no subject)
Summary: Mark Whitt forwarded an email from M.A. Whitt to Gerald Nemec with an attachment labeled "Huber CIG confirm.doc". The email's subject is missing, and the content appears to be an internal communication regarding company matters, possibly personnel or operational updates.

Subject: El Paso imbalance
Summary: Pat Clynes from Enron informs about El Paso's plan to return 238,000 mmbtus to HPL at Moss Bluff, starting on October 26th. The exact daily volume has not yet been specified, with more details to follow.

Subject:
Re: "What To Expect In Western Power Markets This Summer"
 Conference and Other Upcoming Events
Summary: Lysa Akin from Enron informs recipients about Mary Hain's resignation and requests her removal from all mail lists. The email also contains an announcement for an upcoming conference titled "What To Expect in Western Power Markets This Summer," organized by Electric Utility Consultants, Inc. (EUCI), focusing on Western power market issues, including supply, demand, price forecasts, market rules, and regulatory policies. The conference aims to gather industry experts for presentations and discussions. Additional links to other upcoming conferences and workshops are provided.

Subject: New Product Version - Daily TFX
Summary: Steve Kirk requests Tony Pryor's immediate review and approval of new product versions for E.Dubuque deliveries, specifying one for Ventura and another for Demarc. The rates are consistent with previous "R+C" designations. The term "Dly" indicates a daily rollover unless canceled by either party.

Subject:
Energy: Oil Drilling: SURVEY FINDS PRODUCERS PLAN TO SPEND MORE
 THAN ORIGINALLY PLANNED IN ...
Summary:
Lehman Brothers' mid-year survey of 326 oil and gas producers reveals 
an 18.2% increase in planned 2000 worldwide exploration and production 
expenditures, up from the 10.2% anticipated at the start of the year. 
Independent producers are driving this growth with a 26.1% budget increase, 
while major oil companies plan an 8.8% rise. The survey also indicates 
significant budget increases in Canada and international operations, spurred 
by higher natural gas prices and increased cash flow.

Subject: SUPPLEMENTAL Weekend Outage Report for 5-11-01 through 5-14-01
Summary: This email is a supplemental report detailing system outages from May 11 to May 14, 2001. It lists various Enron systems and data centers with scheduled outages for maintenance or upgrades, including Trader DFS reconfiguration, disk upgrades, OS upgrades, and CPU addition. Each outage specifies the impacted environments, purpose, backout plan, and contact information for assistance.

Subject: ISDA Master Agreement
Summary: Marie Heard, Senior Legal Specialist at Enron North America Corp., is reporting an email delivery issue and resending the ISDA Master Agreement. The attached document includes Enron's proposed form of guaranty for ECT Investments, which will only cover amounts above a certain threshold. Enron awaits ECT's schedule in response.

Subject: RE: your nice note
Summary: Jeff Shankman and Ben Macklowe exchange personal messages. Jeff expresses gratitude for not being involved in the 9/11 attacks and shares personal updates, including family matters and recent travels. Ben recounts his relief at his wife Hillary's safety, as she worked in the World Trade Center area, and mentions business updates, including interest in a Galle piece. Both express plans to meet up soon.

Subject: Armada M700 - Laptop Purchase
Summary: Jeff Nguyen informs Susan Scott that all laptop purchases, including the requested Armada M700 with accessories, must go through Karon O'Gorman in the purchasing department. He confirms that Karon can manage the order from Omaha, addressing Susan's request for a laptop, two docking stations, a monitor, and a keyboard.

Subject: FW: Huber Docs
Summary: This email exchange between Barry Tycholiz and Gerald Nemec at Enron pertains to discussing and reviewing documents related to the Huber project. Gerald Nemec has sent draft documents to Barry for review, suggesting they discuss the scope and details over a call. Barry acknowledges receipt and agrees to review the documents with Gerald.

Subject: Super-secret Linux
Summary: This email discusses a collaboration between Network Associates and the National Security Agency (NSA) to enhance the security of Linux through a project called Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux). The aim is to protect Linux servers from attacks like "buffer overrun" and "format string" exploits. The project will eventually be released to the open-source community, potentially leading to more secure commercial Linux distributions for enterprise use.

Subject: RE: petition for declaratory statement
Summary: The email discusses a joint petition for a declaratory statement concerning a public utility's eligibility to serve a customer under Florida Statute 366.03, filed by Gulf Power Company and Enron Compression Services Company. The sender, Gerald Nemec from Enron, is considering approaching WFEC and AEC to discuss this matter and seeks input from Jeff on potential pitfalls. The email also includes a confidentiality notice regarding the contents of the message.

Subject: FW: ENRON CONFIRMATION LETTER - Pool Gas
Summary: This email chain discusses a confirmation letter related to a negotiation between Enron and Southern Co. The letter, prepared by Balch & Bingham llp, contains changes addressing Enron's issues to finalize the deal. Alan Kilpatrick from Southern Co. acknowledges these changes, indicating ongoing negotiations.

Subject: Protocol link
Summary: The email from Smith L. Day of Enron Power Marketing, Inc. shares a link to a document related to protocols on the ERCOT website. The document appears to pertain to draft protocols for retail isolated adhoc committee, likely concerning operational or logistical aspects of power marketing. The inclusion of specific details and contact information suggests an internal, operational communication.

Subject: Re: SM134
Summary: Phillip Allen from Enron is discussing a financial spreadsheet detailing investment and builder profit, suggesting a 65/35 profit split. He proposes a construction agreement with potential adjustments based on meeting budget and schedule targets, which could alter the split to 60/40 or even 55/45. He invites further discussion via phone at his home number.

However, Enron intends to actively engage in the process and assist California in finding a solution that benefits all parties. The email concludes with an affirmation, "Amen."

He suggests contacting specific individuals within Enron for further help and attaches relevant workbooks detailing query results and supply curve creation. The issue revolves around accurately determining marginal costs for hourly generation stack and system marginal cost interpretation.

Subject: TGS PPI
Summary: Pete Weidler from Enron is addressing a financial dispute with the Argentine government regarding TGS's license. The regulator is violating contract terms, causing TGS an estimated $58 million in revenue loss. Weidler plans to work with the US embassy in Argentina, seeking assistance to rectify the situation, and aims to arrange a call on January 31 to discuss a strategy involving DC office representatives. Eduardo Quintana has already met with the US Embassy in Argentina and outlined a plan for engaging with the Argentine government, including meetings with Foreign Affairs Minister Rodriguez Giavarini and Secretary of State Powell. Weidler also intends to send relevant documents to Washington for translation and distribution to Linda and Joe.

Jeffrey Sherrick outlines the plan, including creditor committee support, addressing D&O issues, and drafting a court motion. Tim Detmering informs that the creditors' committee is fine with the transaction, provided certain conditions like escrowing proceeds, addressing D&O insurance in the future, and clarifying deal compensation for EGEP personnel are met. The emails detail the financial and legal aspects of the EOGIL sale to BG.

Subject:
FW: 5 State Energy Advisors Fired Over Conflicts Ethics: The
 consultants were involved in buying electricity for California from a
 generator whose stock they owned, setting up a clash of official duties,
 personal interests.
Summary: The Davis administration fired five energy consultants for conflicts of interest involving their official duties and personal finances, specifically for buying electricity from a generator (Calpine) whose stock they owned. The consultants included Jeffrey L. Rabin, Daryl Kelleher, Richard Ferreira, William F. Mead, Herman Leung, Constantine Louie, and Peggy Cheng. Additionally, two other consultants owned stock in Enron and Southern California Edison. The administration also removed the top lawyer for the agency due to concerns over handling potential conflicts. The firings occurred after belated requests for economic disclosure statements revealed these conflicts, which state law prohibits officials from participating in. Critics question the distinction made by Governor Davis regarding disclosure requirements for certain advisors, including two Wall Street veterans influential in promoting the energy rescue plan.

Richard, an Enron North America attorney handling litigation, will attend the June 8 mediation. Contact for further inquiries should be directed to Richard at 713-853-5587.

She outlines two PR and economic strategies: either revoke the in-service announcement to maintain customer trust or continue with the current situation to retain some reservation charges. Both options have significant drawbacks, including potential loss of customer trust and legal repercussions. Scott emphasizes the urgency of making a decision to avoid escalating customer relations problems.

Subject: EPMI response to FERC investigation--East
Summary: This email from christi.nicolay@enron.com contains EPMI's responses to the FERC investigation regarding discriminatory practices and issues with OATT rules for trading and interconnection activities in the East's bulk power markets. The document "summprob" outlines specific examples of these problems. FERC staff requested similar responses from 10 other power marketers, intending to aggregate the information for a report to the Commission by November 1.

Subject: Enron Mentions
Summary: This email discusses multiple financial and legal issues surrounding Enron, including its tangled web of related entities, potential hidden liabilities, and the impact on its credit rating. Enron's new CFO, Jeff McMahon, is involved in 12 of these entities, raising concerns about conflicts of interest. The company's stock has plummeted due to revelations about its dealings with related parties, and there are fears that Enron might have billions in undisclosed liabilities. Rating agencies have put Enron's credit on review for possible downgrades, and the company drew down $3 billion from credit lines to pay off commercial paper obligations. Additionally, there are lawsuits and investigations into Enron's practices in California and potential ERISA violations concerning its retirement plans.

Subject: Prudency C
Summary: Kevin Presto from Enron proposes using $20 million from 2001 accrual gas position to address Schedule C prudency issues. The allocation includes $10 million for JEA (Northern Florida) short position, $3 million for VEPCO market-based call option with look-back audit, $2 million for MJMUC 40 MW short in a transmission-constrained market, and $5 million for OPPD 110 MW daily shaped call. Each deal involves illiquid markets, delivery problems, and inconsistent scheduling flexibility, making them suitable for Schedule C prudency.

Subject: RE: Intra-day call service at PGL
Summary: Richard Tomaski is verifying intra-day call service transactions at PGL with Martin Cuilla. The transactions listed are for 50,000 units each on 9/8, 9/9, 9/10, and 9/13, at a rate of $0.10 per unit, totaling $20,000 to date. Tomaski seeks agreement on these figures from Cuilla.

Subject: West Books
Summary: Darron Giron provides a list of book names related to West operations, specifying naming conventions for Basis and Gas Daily books. He also offers assistance via phone for any queries.

Subject: RE: How's your back???

They share personal updates about their pets, gardening, and plans for upcoming trips. Chris mentions his search for a perfect partner, while Joni expresses loneliness without her cat and plans to get kittens. The conversation is light-hearted and does not pertain to business, HR, finance, legal matters, or external communications.

Subject: Flag Football Schedule
Summary: Brian Hoskins informs the group about the Enron Flag Football schedule, noting a forfeit due to Danny Campbell's departure and the absence of Team 3. The games are on Wednesday nights at Jaycee Park, with specific times and opponents listed from September to November. Directions to the park are provided.

Subject: Contract Update
Summary: The email discusses a contract update, specifically focusing on the California litigation risk. Mike has signed the contract, and Belden, Richter, and Heizenrader are independently working on language to address risk concerns. They are awaiting proposed language from Michele Cash and a copy of Enron's corporate bylaws regarding officer indemnification.

The deadline for transferring investment fund balances, changing contribution allocation, and adjusting contribution rates is October 26, 3:00pm CST. The plan is transitioning to a new administrator, Vanguard's Lifestrategy options are being replaced with Fidelity Freedom funds, and new system features will be available starting November 20. Support is available via a dedicated helpline from October 29 to November 19.

The next meetings are scheduled for August 27 and September 4 due to a Labor Day holiday on September 3.

The email discusses the weakening U.S. dollar and suggests considering selling long-dated over-the-counter foreign exchange (F/X) or Euro calls to capitalize on this trend, beneficial for Enron's international asset sales. The sender also proposes an alternative strategy of selling calls and buying puts with the proceeds, seeking input on these financial options.

Subject: USTR bilateral
Summary: Nicholas O'Day from Enron is updating on discussions with the US Embassy regarding the next round of US-Japan bilateral talks on energy sector deregulation. Enron advocates for a more cooperative US approach, aiming for significant reforms in Japan's electricity and gas sectors with a timeline for complete deregulation. Enron is developing relationships with key Japanese committees and cabinet ministers to support their message, and seeks feedback on the attached note outlining preliminary discussions.

Subject: Re: technical help for interviewing traders
Summary: Tom Wilbeck from Enron is requesting assistance from John Arnold, known for expertise in interviewing gas traders, to provide technical questions for screening candidates. The questions cover gas market analysis, storage decisions, and derivatives concepts like delta, gamma, theta, and option pricing under varying interest rate scenarios. The urgency is due to Norma Hasenjager's need in the Omaha office.

Subject: Summary of CPUC All-Party Meeting 1/3/01
Summary: This email summarizes a CPUC All-Party Meeting on January 3, 2001, where various parties presented arguments regarding a draft final order. Southern California Edison (SCE) and Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E) criticized the order for failing to address the end of the rate freeze, recovery of past undercollections, and full future procurement cost recovery. The Office of Ratepayer Advocates suggested solutions like encouraging revenue bonds, reducing return on equity, and promoting energy conservation. California Industrial Users supported the proposal but critiqued it for favoring smaller customers, while Enron and Reliant advocated for interim relief and re-examination of the surcharge. Citizen and consumer advocates expressed satisfaction with the proposed decision but urged the CPUC to study the impact of rate increases on the California economy. A private attorney suggested delaying the rate surcharge until utility bankruptcy filings to incentivize cases against marketers.

Subject: Texas EOL DATA
Summary: Eric Bass from Enron provides updated End-of-Life (EOL) data for the Texas region, detailing planned trades and volumes for 2000 and 2001. He requests an update to the plan numbers for Tom.

Summary: Eric Gillaspie is preparing to send a demand letter regarding an easement encroachment issue. He has sought approval from Richard B Sanders before sending it out. The letter is intended for both the current co-owner and an additional party, Ann Elizabeth White.

Vikas plans to visit in person to discuss the feasibility of this arrangement.

Mark plans to compile a detailed report on the methodology and findings, aiming to complete it within a few days, and is open to feedback on the preliminary results.

The email also includes links to full articles on the NYTimes.com website.

Subject: Project Sunrise
Summary: This email discusses Project Sunrise, an initiative to optimize the use of SAP in financial, HR, and global sourcing areas. The project involves teams led by Jan Johnson (Financial processes) and Mark Frank (Reporting) focusing on creating better reporting capabilities, improving information quality and timeliness, and shortening the close process. Various business unit representatives and subject matter experts are involved, with specific roles in interviewing accounting personnel, developing a data warehouse, and creating a web-based reporting tool. The project aims to enhance business efficiency and information accessibility across Enron.

Subject:
(01-91) Exchange Selects GlobalView Software Inc. c for enymex
 Customer Interface Infrastructure
Summary: The New York Mercantile Exchange has selected GlobalView Software Inc. to develop the infrastructure for enymex, its e-commerce venture focusing on energy and metals trading. GlobalView will provide MarketView, a web-enabled product for market information integration, delivery, and display. The enymex platform, set to launch in Q2 2001, aims to offer a neutral internet-based trading and clearing solution, reducing counterparty credit risk with a consolidated clearing position.

Subject: Revised outline for policy paper
Summary: Seabron Adamson from Frontier Economics has shared a revised outline for a policy paper focusing on RTO (Regional Transmission Organization) development. The paper will model a centralized unit commitment process similar to PJM Light with energy-only bids, involving financial transmission rights. It will cover market power issues, the relationship between wholesale and retail market development, and propose a set of policy recommendations for establishing workable markets nationwide. The email also contains a disclaimer about the confidential nature of the document.

Subject: Btrieve free ride ends
Summary: The email discusses changes in NetWare 5.1 regarding the database system. Originally, NetWare included Btrieve, a flat-file database system later bought and rebranded by Novell as Pervasive SQL 2000. NetWare 5.1 no longer provides an unlimited-use version of Pervasive SQL 2000, only a two-user license for administrative tasks. An evaluation version of the full-use license is available but expires after 90 days. Users need to purchase licenses from Pervasive Software or check if their applications are compatible with the new system before upgrading.

Subject: EGM opportunities in Bush Energy Plan
Summary: Jeff Keeler, Director of Environmental Strategies at Enron, outlines opportunities within the Bush Energy Plan for Enron's Environmental Group (EGM). Short-term opportunities include $2 billion over ten years for Clean Coal Technologies, with immediate funding available for FY 2002, and potential R&D funding or tax incentives. Keeler also mentions New Source Review (NSR) Reforms, where a DOJ decision on enforcement could occur in summer 2001, impacting coal-using utilities and potentially benefiting Enron's coal trading and technology plays. Long-term opportunities involve advocating for multipollutant legislation that would streamline regulation of NOx, SO2, and mercury, and provide relief from NSR requirements, benefiting EGM's emissions trading and technology businesses. Enron's Environmental Strategies group has developed a multipollutant plan and is working to gain support from key officials, anticipating a lengthy debate.

Subject: RE: Business Practice #11
Summary: The email discusses the control and distribution of energy generated by five hydro projects in the Mid-Columbia region, owned by Douglas County PUD, Chelan County PUD, and Grant County PUD. It explains that some generation is sold to participants who have transmission capabilities to move their share to their control areas. The email introduces the concept of a "Mid-C HUB" where Chelan and Grant PUDs will combine control area boundaries for scheduling and tagging purposes, facilitating energy transfers between participants. Douglas County PUD is not part of this hub. The discussion revolves around Business Practice #11 concerning tagging and reservation fields for energy transactions at a single bus, specifically in the Mid-Columbia region.

He also mentions potential delays in report submission due to the Nation's regulations and current backlogs, aiming to expedite the process.

Subject:
Utilities, Electric: Deregulation: Electricity deregulation brings
 on crisis in California
Summary: The email discusses a crisis in California's electricity market due to deregulation, with wholesale power prices surging to $500/MWhr from $150/MWhr in summer 1999. Retail prices are frozen until March 2002, while demand has only grown by 3%. Power generators attribute the crisis to the deregulated sector's rigid nature, but some consumers suspect profiteering. The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) is expected to release findings on the energy crisis by November 1, 2000.

Summary: Bruce Stram forwards a resume of an individual, Allan Lambert, seeking a risk management or quantitative job role. Bruce asks Vince Kaminski for direction on potential openings within Enron, suggesting Vince contact Allan directly if interested. Allan Lambert is associated with Watkins & Associates.

Subject: Request for Freeze on E-Mail Destruction
Summary: Diane Goode, Senior Specialist at Enron, requests a freeze on email destruction for several employees involved in the Bid/Ask patent litigation. The individuals mentioned are Jay Webb, Kevin Montagne, Jarod M. Jenson, Mark E. Taylor (legal), Michael Guadarrama, Louise Kitchen, Marcello Romano (London), Rennu G. Varghese, and David Forster. An additional list of IT personnel will be sent on Tuesday, and Goode seeks assistance to expedite the process.

Subject: CORNSHUCKER 3/6 & 3/7
Summary: Mark McCoy informs about changes made to tickets #458433 (Brazos) and #384258 (Tenaska IV) related to gas volumes for March 6th and 7th. He requests confirmation if the changes are correct and inquires about the expected operational status of the plant. The updated spreadsheet reflects volumes of 27,966 for the 6th and 19,735 for the 7th from Brazos.

Subject: Saturday Visit from Enron Canada Rep
Summary: Neil Stuchbury from Enron Canada's Toronto office will visit on Saturday to observe real-time trading expertise. Murray, a consultant for the Toronto office, has arranged this visit for Neil to gain insights.

Subject: Re: IPP Matters
Summary: Scott Healy requests assistance for Don Black's projects, specifically in summarizing short position information and analyzing the TECO deal. Healy also informs about regular IPP group meetings on Mondays at 4 PM and mentions ongoing discussions about various projects including TBG Gas Restructuring, Fiatt model, tolling options for a power plant, tax deals in Illinois and Mississippi, and an IPP contact tracking sheet. Healy inquires about the status of the Fiatt model and seeks updates on these projects.

Summary: This email pertains to operational updates, specifically concerning gas (35) and power (37) status or reports for Amerex on April 18. It appears to be a factual report rather than a discussion or request for action.

The email chain indicates internal discussions and sharing of information regarding potential financial benefits or implications tied to tax credits.

The sender's professional title and the nature of the nuclear power corporation suggest a document related to compliance, accounting, or legal notifications.

Subject: Meeting Status: Capture Behavioral data on all Failures
Summary: Steven Kean requests Maureen to check his calendar regarding a meeting scheduled for December 1st at McDonald's Headquarters near Chicago. The meeting involves participants from General Motors, Dupont, McDonald's, NASA, and Enron. Richard Jones suggests discussing the meeting details on Wednesday if Steven is available, as he will be traveling on Tuesday.

Subject: Overview of Investor Conference Call
Summary: Enron's Chairman, Kenneth Lay, provides an overview of the company's financial situation in a conference call for investors. The company acknowledges poor investments in non-core businesses like Azurix, India, and Brazil, leading to over-leveraging and damaged investor confidence. Enron plans to exit non-core businesses, generating billions in cash to repay debt and reinvest in core businesses. The company also discusses separating its businesses into core, non-core, and those under review, with a focus on maintaining investment-grade credit ratings despite recent downgrades by major agencies. A 10-Q filing will be delayed due to ongoing activities, and a full transcript of the conference call will be available on their website and filed with the SEC.

Subject: Organization Changes
Summary: Enron is reorganizing its operations by forming Enron Global Services (EGS) to streamline asset-based businesses, enhance synergies, and prioritize high-value opportunities. EGS will oversee various energy assets including pipelines, power, distribution, and utilities like Portland General Electric and EOTT Energy Corp. The reorganization places specific business units and support functions under designated leaders to ensure efficient utilization of commercial support services.

Subject: Energy Efficiency, etc. Incentives
Summary: Jeff Dasovich informs colleagues about an upcoming meeting on October 7th to discuss allocating $50 million from California AB 970 for energy conservation and demand-side management programs. Brian Smith from Enron Energy Services' Costa Mesa office will attend, following a conference call with Jeff and Bob Frank. Harry Kingerski is compiling information on potential new federal, state, or other initiatives that could incentivize investments in demand-side management, responding to Larry Derrett's inquiry.

Subject: Reminder - Annual Compliance Meeting
Summary: Donna Lowry from Enron reminds employees about the mandatory Annual Compliance Meeting on October 25, 2001, at the Doubletree Hotel, LaSalle Room B, from 8:30 am to 10:30 am. The agenda includes updates on board seats, ECT Securities LP, Risk Management Policy, Chinese Wall Policy, Transaction Approval Process, and RAC Reporting Tools. Attendance is required, and participants are asked to RSVP to Donna Wackerle.

Subject: Enron Year End 2000 Performance Management Process
Summary: Enron initiates its Year-End 2000 Performance Management Process. Employees are reminded to suggest reviewers for performance feedback via PEP at http://pep.corp.enron.com by November 17th. HelpDesk support is available in Houston, London, and via email for any queries related to the process.

Subject: Conference - Mexico
Summary: Jaime Williams is informing about an upcoming conference in Mexico, scheduled for the 19th in Monterrey and the 20th in Mexico City. Approximately 550 customers will be invited via email, with an estimated response rate of 140 to 250 attendees. The budget for the event, including room reservations, printed materials, translation, and a cocktail hour, is projected to range between $14,000 and $20,000, contingent on the required print materials. The conferences will take place at the "Industrial's Club" venues. Jaime has attached the invitation and included the recipient in the agenda for welcoming remarks.

Subject: Re: Merrick
Summary: Robert Walker is requesting specific details for the Merrick contract, including the legal name, state of incorporation, physical address, contact information, scope of work, start date, and a contact name at Merrick. He has gathered most of the information but is missing these key details.

Subject: Re: MMS meeting sheduled for Friday afternoon Feb 9th.
Summary: Drew Fossum discusses legal statutes governing MMS (Mineral Management Service) oil and gas royalty programs, mentioning the Mineral Leasing Act and other relevant statutes. He suggests the need for a "real dirt lawyer" with expertise in hard rock mining and surface rights. Fossum also inquires about the MMS RFP (Request for Proposal) process, aiming to find potential loopholes to benefit Enron. Paul Bieniawski is conducting research on statutory authority regarding the origin of the 12.5% figure and seeks Fossum's insights on the MMS RFP process.

Subject: Proposed Addition to Enfolio Firm General Terms & Conditions
Summary: This email from gouinmd@nu.com proposes changes to the Enfolio Firm General Terms & Conditions, specifically introducing credit assurances language. If one party deems the other's creditworthiness or performance unsatisfactory, they must provide written notice requesting performance assurance. Failure to provide acceptable credit assurance within three business days results in an Event of Default, triggering remedies outlined in Section 3 of the Firm GTC.

Subject: EIM Organization Change
Summary: Enron Industrial Markets (EIM) is expanding into Pulp, Paper, and Steel markets with a focus on Europe. Bruce Garner has been appointed as President and CEO of EIM - Europe to oversee all operations in this region. The email encourages congratulations for Bruce's new role.

Subject: Institute of Americas Presentation - Brazil Energy Crisis
Summary: Jose is requesting Adriana to convert a presentation on the Brazil Energy Crisis into an Acrobat format. This presentation was likely used in a recent event at the Institute of Americas. The email pertains to external communications, possibly related to partners or clients, given its topic and context.

Kate Symes from Enron is reminding her team to follow up on a deal involving a new counterparty introduced by Diana Scholtes. She forgot to address the matter during the day and requests a call in the morning to get updated instructions.

Subject: Please Tell us where to send your FREE watch!
Summary: This email is an external promotional offer for a free sports watch from Intervolved.net. The recipient, daren, is informed that they have won a Caribbean Blue Exelo Gelly watch and is urged to claim it quickly as the inventory is limited. The email includes product specifications and a call to action to click the provided link to secure the watch.

Subject: RE: EES-CAL Book
Summary: Vladimir Gorny inquires about the EES-CAL book, noting discrepancies such as incorrect Nepool positions and missing Value at Risk (VaR) reporting. He confirms he will attempt to rectify these issues on the same day.

Subject: Re: EB Location
Summary: The email discusses the need for Chris Germany's Energy Business (EB) location to send him a drill owner's manual. Additionally, it requests the return of a house key previously lent to Chris.

Subject: Re: Li Xiao
Summary: This email exchange pertains to an internal company matter, specifically Vince Kaminski writing a recommendation letter for Li Xiao's graduate school tuition loan application, as requested by Molly Magee. The emails are between two employees discussing this HR-related task.

Subject: Viewing Electronic Pay Stubs
Summary: Enron is introducing a new feature on eHRonline, allowing employees to view and print direct deposit advice electronically starting November 15. The process involves logging in with a "P" number and password, navigating to Pay Information > Paycheck Inquiry, selecting the payroll period, and clicking through to view and print the pay stub using Adobe Acrobat Reader. An Information Booth will be available from November 13-15, 11 am to 2 pm in the Enron North lobby for demonstrations and further details.

Subject: University Affairs Contact List
Summary: Cindy provides a contact list for university affairs, noting it's incomplete and will be updated by Christie. Mike will supply phone numbers for specific universities. Cindy suggests leveraging personal relationships with faculty and deans to overcome Enron's damaged credibility in academic discussions.

Subject: Politicians seek shelter as energy Armageddon looms
Summary: This email discusses the political fallout surrounding California's energy crisis in early 2001. Politicians, including Governor Gray Davis, are shifting focus away from the crisis due to its complexity and potential negative impact on their political careers. The Democratic Party is concerned about accountability in the upcoming 2002 elections, while Republicans see an opportunity to regain relevance by criticizing Davis' handling of the situation. Despite Davis' efforts to defend his actions, the crisis shows no signs of improvement, with ongoing high power purchase costs, stalled long-term supply contracts, and the looming threat of summer blackouts and utility bankruptcies.

Subject: Re: FX Issues
Summary: This email discusses financial and legal issues related to foreign exchange (FX) transactions at Enron. The primary concern is the tax and legal implications of transactions executed by the London FX desk on behalf of ENA, with Enron Europe Finance & Trading Limited (EEFT) acting as agent. The email also raises questions about applying the same logic to internal FX transactions, potential tax relief, and the classification of FX transactions as financial products. Additionally, it touches on technology issues, such as creating appropriate deal and product types for FX index products within Enron's systems.

Subject: Greening the Enron Building Mtg
Summary: Stacey Bolton invites colleagues to a meeting on March 22nd at 2 PM in EB50MO3 to discuss energy commodity and renewable energy credits for the Enron Building, Stadium, and Center. The purpose is to align efforts and consider proposals from Enron Wind and ENA to retire renewable energy credits, making Enron the first Fortune 500 company to "go green" in its headquarters. The meeting will also cover switching from Reliant to EES for commodity and strategizing a win-win proposal for both economic and PR benefits, aiming for an Earth Day announcement.

Subject: FW: System Imbalance Notice
Summary: This email from Williams.com, forwarded by Victor Lamadrid, informs Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corporation customers and shippers about excessive negative transportation imbalances on Transco's system. It advises avoiding further negative imbalances and returning to a balanced position, with a warning of potential suspension of make-up deliveries if voluntary compliance isn't achieved. Starting October 26, Transco will implement stricter pooling point practices, reducing the tolerance from 4% to 1% or 1,000 dts for shippers with negatively scheduled imbalances.

The email chain involves internal communications regarding a forwarded message from Greg Couch to Victor Guggenheim, which was then forwarded to Darron C Giron. The content pertains to business operations or logistics, possibly discussing projects or issues within Enron North America Corp, as no explicit subject or content is provided in the snippet.

Subject: ABX2 2 - Windfall Profits
Summary: The email discusses the progress of bill ABX2 2 (Corbett) in the Assembly Appropriations Committee, which has been placed on the Suspense File due to its projected fiscal impact exceeding $150,000. The Suspense File review is scheduled for May 31. Assembly Member Corbett is considering amendments to exempt co-generation, new power plants, and existing long-term contracts, while raising the price from $60 to $100.

Subject: Re: Annual Election of Officers
Summary: Walter Zimmerman, Senior Counsel at EOTT Energy Corp, is circulating a draft resolution for the reelection of the current slate of officers for the upcoming year. The draft is intended for review before it is included in the materials for the May Board of Directors meeting. He requests feedback on any necessary changes to the proposed officer slate.

Subject: Natural Gas Origination
Summary: This email discusses internal restructuring within Enron's natural gas business to optimize operations and facilitate growth. The Producer/Wellhead Group in Central and Eastern Gas Regions will be consolidated under Fred Lagrasta, creating a unified business unit for producing industry needs in the Eastern U.S. Laura Luce will lead strategic asset development in the Central and Eastern Regions, focusing on long-term partnerships for asset development and optimization. Frank Vickers will take on leadership for Mid-Market and Origination in the Central Region, while West and Texas Origination groups remain unchanged.

Subject: California Update--08.27.01
Summary: Jeff Dasovich from Enron provides an update on California's energy situation. The California PUC amended its proposal regarding Direct Access, ending it retroactively to July 1. Customers with contracts from July 1 onwards remain under Direct Access. The Assembly version of SB 78 is scheduled for a committee vote today, with amendments offering exemptions for certain Direct Access customers from specific charges, contingent on PUC findings about stranded costs. Direct Access suspension is set for 90 days after the bill's signing, with self-generation customers also receiving exemptions under certain conditions.

Subject: Re: Your Invitation to Enron's Executive Forum - 1st Quarter 2001
Summary: This email is an invitation to an Enron Executive Forum for participants of the Executive Impact and Influence Program within the past two years. The forum aims to facilitate open dialogue between executives and the Office of the Chairman on various topics, including Enron's direction, business goals, M&A activities, projects, culture, leadership, and management practices. Participants are encouraged to actively engage and submit questions or issues in advance, with sessions scheduled for March 29 or March 30, 2001. RSVP is required by March 16, 2001, to Debbie Nowak.

Subject: For Discussion: Implementing Definition of Trading Office
Summary: Richard Sage proposes two models for implementing the definition of a trading office: one allowing local commodity buying and selling but requiring hedging through the Regional Hub, and another involving an agency model with local traders acting under hub direction. Sage expresses dissatisfaction with the agency model and suggests independent Risk Managers in each office, with all correspondence and settlements handled through the regional hub. He seeks input on these ideas.

Subject: GE
Summary: Scott Dieball has shared the latest markup on warranty language currently under review by GE. He suggests discussing further with GE next week. Scott also mentions that Steve Swift will email Sheila Tweed with agreed-upon indemnity details for the Arcos contract, and Scott will not use the "end world hunger" warranty language in Arcos due to back-to-back obligations with the EPC contract owner.

Subject: Prepared Testimony in I.99-07-003
Summary: Susan Scott from Transwestern Pipeline Company is sending the Prepared Direct Testimony of Jeffery C. Fawcett in support of a Comprehensive Settlement Agreement. The document, labeled as Exhibit 12, was previously delivered in hard copy on May 5 and is now provided in electronic form. Contact information is included for any issues with the electronic version.

Subject: URGENT! Join the Bush "SWAT" Team
Summary: Tony Garza from onr.com is recruiting volunteers to join the Bush campaign's "SWAT" team to boost voter turnout in key battleground states. Those interested are asked to provide travel availability and contact information. The campaign aims to energize voters and ensure high turnout during early voting and Election Day.
